```{r}
library(dplyr)

your_dataset <- read.csv("car.csv")

your_dataset <- na.omit(your_dataset)

your_dataset$Year <- as.integer(your_dataset$Year)
your_dataset$Manufacturer <- as.character(your_dataset$Manufacturer)
your_dataset$Model <- as.character(your_dataset$Model)

your_dataset <- your_dataset %>%
  filter(EngineVolume > 0 & EngineVolume < 10,
         Price > 0 & Price < 100000)

your_dataset$Manufacturer <- tolower(your_dataset$Manufacturer)
your_dataset$Model <- tolower(your_dataset$Model)

your_dataset$CarAge <- 2020 - your_dataset$Year

subsets_by_manufacturer <- split(your_dataset, your_dataset$Manufacturer)

manufacturer_names <- names(subsets_by_manufacturer)
print(manufacturer_names)

```



```{r}
library(shiny)
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
library(dplyr)
library(DT)


ui <- fluidPage(
    titlePanel("Car Model Detailed Information Panel"),
    sidebarLayout(
        sidebarPanel(
            selectizeInput("model1", "Select First Model:", choices = NULL),
            selectizeInput("model2", "Select Second Model:", choices = NULL)
        ),
        mainPanel(
            plotlyOutput("comparisonPlot"),
            DTOutput("modelDetailsTable")
        )
    )
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {
    observe({
        updateSelectizeInput(session, "model1", choices = unique(your_dataset$Model), server = TRUE)
        updateSelectizeInput(session, "model2", choices = unique(your_dataset$Model), server = TRUE)
    })

    output$comparisonPlot <- renderPlotly({
        validate(
            need(input$model1 %in% your_dataset$Model, "Please select a valid first model."),
            need(input$model2 %in% your_dataset$Model, "Please select a valid second model.")
        )
        
        data_model1 <- filter(your_dataset, Model == input$model1)
        data_model2 <- filter(your_dataset, Model == input$model2)
        
        p <- ggplot() +
            geom_boxplot(data = data_model1, aes(x = 'Model 1', y = Price), fill = 'blue') +
            geom_boxplot(data = data_model2, aes(x = 'Model 2', y = Price), fill = 'red') +
            labs(title = "Price Comparison Between Models", x = "", y = "Price") +
            theme_minimal()

        ggplotly(p)
    })

    output$modelDetailsTable <- renderDT({
        req(input$model1, input$model2)

        details_model1 <- your_dataset %>% 
            filter(Model == input$model1) %>%
            summarize(Manufacturer = first(Manufacturer),
                      Model = first(Model),
                      FuelType = first(FuelType),
                      Doors = first(Doors),
                      Wheel = first(Wheel),
                      Color = first(Color),
                      MedianPrice = median(Price, na.rm = TRUE),
                      MedianMileage = median(Mileage, na.rm = TRUE),
                      MedianEngineVolume = median(EngineVolume, na.rm = TRUE))

        details_model2 <- your_dataset %>% 
            filter(Model == input$model2) %>%
            summarize(Manufacturer = first(Manufacturer),
                      Model = first(Model),
                      FuelType = first(FuelType),
                      Doors = first(Doors),
                      Wheel = first(Wheel),
                      Color = first(Color),
                      MedianPrice = median(Price, na.rm = TRUE),
                      MedianMileage = median(Mileage, na.rm = TRUE),
                      MedianEngineVolume = median(EngineVolume, na.rm = TRUE))

        combined_details <- rbind(details_model1, details_model2)
        datatable(combined_details, options = list(pageLength = 5, searching = FALSE))
    })
}

shinyApp(ui, server)

```
